title: AirIQ Reports First Quarter 2026 Earnings
description: AirIQ ( CVE:IQ ) First Quarter 2026 Results Key Financial Results Revenue: CA$1.42m (down 14% from 1Q 2025). Net...
content:
• Profit margin: 1.1% (down from 6.5% in 1Q 2025).

Trump has pledged to "unleash" American oil and gas and these 15 US stocks have developments that are poised to benefit.

All figures shown in the chart above are for the trailing 12 month (TTM) period

You should learn about the 4 warning signs we've spotted with AirIQ (including 1 which is significant).

We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.
summary: The article discusses the potential benefits of President Donald Trump's proposed policies on American oil and gas. However, the article also mentions four warning signs, including a significant 1.1% profit margin for the company. The article is based on historical data and analyst forecasts, not intended to be a recommendation for a purchase or modification.
shortSummary: Despite recent setbacks, AirIQ's earnings report shows signs of resilience and potential future success under President Trump, with potential for future success despite ongoing challenges.

About the Company
| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1997 | n/a | Mike Robb | www.airiq.com |
AirIQ Inc. provides IoT based asset management solutions in North America. The company offers fleet reporting, maintenance, compliance, safety, and analytics utilizing multiple hardware options, including a fully integrated video telematics camera solution, and a battery powered solution for non-powered assets. It also provides fleet management, trailer tracking, field services application, video telematics, battery powered solutions, and cutting edge solutions.

Results
22
Midstream oil and gas companies, specifically pipeline operators, are well-positioned to benefit from Trump’s executive orders on fossil fuels enacted in early 2025. – – These policies aim to accelerate infrastructure development by streamlining environmental reviews and permitting processes, such as those under the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA). The declaration of a "national energy emergency" further empowers these companies by prioritizing pipeline and storage projects to support increased production from newly accessible federal lands and waters. – – The push to "unleash American energy" also amplifies demand for midstream services as upstream production ramps up, particularly in regions like Alaska and offshore areas reopened for drilling. Pipelines and storage facilities will be critical to moving larger volumes of oil and gas efficiently, especially with the renewed emphasis on LNG exports to meet global demand.

argos_summary: Trump’s 2025 executive orders aim to accelerate fossil fuel infrastructure, giving a boost to midstream oil and gas companies that transport and store energy. The orders streamline environmental reviews, declare a national energy emergency, and prioritize pipeline and storage projects, especially in Alaska and offshore drilling areas. As a result, 22 midstream firms—including Chevron, Kinder Morgan, Williams, and Cheniere—are positioned to benefit from increased production and LNG export demand. The article also highlights AirIQ Inc., a Canadian IoT asset‑management firm, noting its modest financials and recent earnings decline.
